Rreth Nesh

Ne jemi nje komunitet i dedikuar per te ndihmuar njerezit te mesojne programim nga fillimi deri ne nivel te avancuar. Qellimi yne eshte te ofrojme burime te cilat jane te aksesueshme per te gjithe dhe te ndertojme nje komunitet mbeshtetes ku anetaret mund te ndajne njohurite dhe eksperiencat e tyre.

Misioni yne

Misioni yne eshte te fuqizojme individet me aftesite dhe njohurite e nevojshme per te pasur sukses ne boten dixhitale. Ne besojme se programimi eshte nje aftesi thelbesore ne epoken moderne dhe jemi te perkushtuar per ta bere mesimin e programimit sa me te aksesueshem dhe efektiv.

Vizioni yne

Vizioni yne eshte te krijojme nje komunitet global ku cdo person, pavarësisht prejardhjes apo nivelit te aftesive, mund te mesoje, rritet dhe kontribuoje ne fushen e teknologjise. Ne synojme te jemi nje burim i besueshem i informacionit dhe mbeshtetjes per cdo person qe deshiron te mesoje programim.

title: Copilot Chat losing credential of OpenRouter added models.
body:

title: Custom toolsets, applied to chatmodes, do not include built-in versions of tools with ambiguous names as with MCPs or extensions
body:
Type: Bug Bug Description When creating custom toolsets, VS Code does not include the built-in versions of tools if there is an ambiguous name collision, such as with MCP (Model Context Protocol) tools. For example, if a custom toolset includes a tool with the same name as a built-in tool (for instance, 'search'), only one version is available, and the built-in version is omitted. This leads to missing functionality and unpredictable behavior for agent workflows and MCP servers. Steps to Reproduce Create a custom toolset (and apply to a chatmode) that includes a tool with a name identical to a built-in tool (e.g., 'search'). Register an MCP server/tool with the same name. Attempt to use both through the toolset in VS Code. Observe that only one version (usually the custom tool/MCP) is available, and the built-in tool is missing. Expected Behavior Both the built-in and custom tools should be available in the toolset, or there should be a clear, user-configurable mechanism for resolving ambiguity and explicitly including/excluding specific tool variants. Actual Behavior The built-in tool is omitted from the toolset if a custom tool/MCP with the same name exists, causing missing functionality and confusion. Additional Context This affects agent workflows and enterprise environments with overlapping tool names. title: Add notification positioning setting
body: ## Summary Adds a new `workbench.notifications.position` setting that allows users to position notification toasts in any bottom corner of the workbench (bottom-right, bottom-left). This stems from an issue I face constantly, where notifications on the bottom right would often overlap my copilot chat window. ## Changes - **Configuration**: Added `workbench.notifications.position` setting with enum validation - **Constants**: Added `NotificationPosition` enum and `NOTIFICATIONS_POSITION_SETTING` constant - **Logic**: Enhanced `NotificationsToasts` and `NotificationsCenter` to apply position classes based on configuration - **Styling**: Added CSS for both bottom corner positions with proper animations and width constraints - **Accessibility**: Maintained existing behavior and animations, added smooth transitions for all positions ## Implementation Details - Default behavior unchanged (bottom-right positioning) - Proper flex alignment for left vs right positioned notifications - Configuration changes applied immediately without restart ## Testing 1. Change `workbench.notifications.position` setting in user settings 2. Trigger notifications (info, warning, error) 3. Verify notifications appear in correct corner 4. Test all positions: `bottomRight`, `bottomLeft` 5. Verify animations work correctly for each position ## Screenshots

title: Improve Manage Trusted Extensions Settings Dialog

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

## Current Behavior

Manage Trusted Extensions Dialog is not displaying which extension is using which account and also to change we need to do it individually for each extension.

## Recommended Behavior

Manage Trusted Extensions Dialog should display current account name alongside each extension and we should be able to change account for each extension from this dialog only instead of opening new dialog for each extension.

labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
**Please do not close this bug. This bug should only be closed by Trusted Tester after verification.**
"[Check out Accessibility Insights!](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https://accessibilityinsights.io/&data=02%7c01%7cv-stfe%40microsoft.com%7cb67b2c4b646d4f9561a208d6f4b5c39b%7c72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7c1%7c0%7c636965458850501301&sdata=mxhokIKNMb22llsjXHLgU3XZibj1Qfx37rpY4PU2sfE%3D&reserved=0) - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier."

## GitHub Tags
#A11yeDAD; #A11yMAS; #A11yTCS; #Win32; #A11ySev2;#DesktopApp; #Visual Studio Code Client; #BM-VisualStudioCodeClient-Win32-Jan2024; #WCAG1.3.1; #FTP; #Screen Reader; #JAWS; #Element:chatboard; #STP; #NVDA; 

## Environment Details:
Application: VS Code
Visual studio code version: 1.103.2
OS: Windows 11 Enterprise 24H2
Build: 26100.2605
Screen reader
JAWS version: 2025.2504.89
NVDA: 2024.4.2

## Repro Steps

1. Turn on Jaws/NVDA screen reader
2. Open Visual Studio Code 
3. Ensure GitHub Copilot is installed and signed in.
4. TAB till "Select model" and press ENTER key.
5. Select a model and given some prompt in GitHub copilot chat input and press ENTER key.
6. Repeat this previews step by selecting different model.
7. TAB till Copilot response
8. Observer the issue

## Actual Experience.
When there are multiple copilot responses in the chat for different selected models, the "Selected Model" and "Model model multiplier" information appears at the bottom right corner of each response. However, this information is not accessible with a screen reader when navigating through that specific response.

## Expected Experience
The "Selected Model" and "Model model multiplier" information, which is displayed in the bottom right corner of each copilot response, should be accessible to screen readers when navigating through the copilot response.

## User Impact:
When there are multiple responses for different selected models, it can be challenging for screen reader users to identify which model is associated with each response.

title: Add support for SVGs for product icons

labels.name: themes
labels.description: Color theme issues

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

Allowing the use of SVG files for product icons could unlock more ways to customise the VS Code interface. For example, users could use duotone icons (single colour, different opacities) and have better details. Icons could also be easier to manage in design tools like Figma. However, iconsfonts are being superseded to manage iconography in 2025. They are hard to maintain, and the PUA may have missing icons or replaced them with OSS ones.

A new and better way could be using SVG sprites with symbols. So, in addition to icon fonts, we could set the path to the sag sprite, and for icons we could just set the symbols id to render: read more https://nucleoapp.com/blog/post/how-to-add-and-manage-icons-in-web-projects-using-svg-symbols
